item.title: Recommended Anti-Virus
item.description: Rankings are based on SimeonOnSecurity’s professional opinion and basic testing against malicious samples provided by VirusTotal. These recommendations do not take into account vendors privacy policies or related practices and only cover the AV capabilities, detection, user experience, and performance. Notes: Generally speaking, AV is not required on Linux or MacOS. It is not recommended to use any VPN or password manager thay may be provided with the AV suite.

item.title: Recommended Browser Plugins
item.description: Note: The only daily-driver browser I recommend is FireFox. Alternatively you should be using the TOR Browser. Do not install plugins in the TOR browser. U-Block Origin - Prefered - A great Open-Source AD blocker. HTTPS Everywhere - Prefered - Forces your browser to load sites over HTTPS rather than HTTP Decentraleyes - Local CDN Emulator ClearURLs - Dynamically removes tracking tags from links CanvasBlocker - Prevents JavaScript Fingerprinting Multi Account Containers - Allows for isolated brower sessions Terms of Service, Didn’t Read - Informs user of shady ToS Bitwarden - Secure Open-Source Cloud Password Manager Privacy Badger - Learns and blocks trackers

item.title: Recommended Privacy Resources
item.description: “Privacy is a fundamental right, and essential to democracy, liberty, and freedom of speech. Our privacy is being abused by governments (with mass-surveillance), corporations (profiting from selling personal data), and cyber criminals (stealing our poorly-secured personal data and using it against us). Security is needed in order to keep your private data private, and good digital security is critical to stay protected from the growing risks associated with the war on data.
